sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>grain</radical>, from one <radical>evening</radical> to the next <radical>evening</radical>, experiences a <kanji>shift</kanji>. After two evenings, the grain has shifted from one location to another.
meaningInfo: Picture the grain in your head with a time-lapse of one evening after another happening in the background. Slowly, the grain shifts.
readingMnemonic: This <kanji>shift</kanji> is caused by the <reading>ea</reading>gle (<ja>い</ja>) that wants to eat the grains. Every other evening, the eagle swoops down, shifts the grains (eating a few) and then flies off.
readingInfo: Picture the eagle flying down on the second evening, scattering the grains it doesn't eat, shifting their location.
